the son. 
"The will will show that, my dear; our fate also depends on it." 
"But why do you expect that he will leave us anything?" 
"Ah, my dear! He is so rich, and we are so poor!" 
"Well, that is hardly a sufficient reason, Mamma . . ." 
"Oh, Heaven! How ill he is!" exclaimed the mother. 
AFTER ANNA MIKHAYLOVNA had driven off with her son to visit Count Cyril Vladfmirovich Be- ziikhov, Countess Rost6va sat for a long time all alone applying her handkerchief to her eyes. At last she rang.
